AsyncAPY package¶

Submodules¶

AsyncAPY.base module¶

class AsyncAPY.base.AsyncAPY(addr: Optional[str] = '127.0.0.1', port: Optional[int] = 8081, buf: Optional[int] = 1024, logging_level: int = 20, console_format: Optional[str] = '[%(levelname)s] %(asctime)s %(message)s', datefmt: Optional[str] = '%d/%m/%Y %H:%M:%S %p', timeout: Optional[int] = 60, header_size: int = 2, byteorder: str = 'big', proto: str = 'json', config: str = None, cfg_parser=None)¶

Bases: object

This class is the base class for the AsyncAPython framework.

It implements a simple but reliable protocol over TCP with JSON requests, handling the hassle of sockets and other protocol-related operations at a low level and asynchronously, exposing a high level and easy to use API only.

Also, things such as TCP slow start and stream fragmentation are also handled by the AsyncAPython protocol, which grants that every request is separated from another one thanks to a simple header system

add_handler(handler, name, filters=None, priority: int = 0)¶
banned = {}¶
async complete_stream(header, stream: trio.SocketStream, session_id: uuid.uuid4)¶

This functions completes the stream until the specified length is reached

groups = {}¶
async handle_client(stream: trio.SocketStream)¶

This function handles a single client connection:

  • It assigns a unique ID to each client session

  • It listens on the asynchronous socket and acts accordingly

e.g. incomplete streams or abrupt disconnection - It handles timeouts if the client hangs for some reason

handler_add(name, filters=None, priority: int = 0)¶
handlers = {}¶
async invalid_json_request(session_id: uuid.uuid4, stream: trio.SocketStream)¶
load_config()¶
async malformed_request(session_id: uuid.uuid4, stream: trio.SocketStream)¶
async missing_field(session_id: uuid.uuid4, stream: trio.SocketStream, missing_field: str)¶
async parse_call(session_id: uuid.uuid4, request: bytes, stream: trio.SocketStream)¶

This function parses the API request and acts accordingly

async rebuild_incomplete_stream(session_id: uuid.uuid4, stream: trio.SocketStream, raw_data)¶

This function gets called when a stream’s length is smaller than self.header_size bytes, which is the minimum amount of data needed to parse an API call (The length header)

remove_handler(name)¶
async send_response(stream: trio.SocketStream, response_data: bytes, session_id, close: bool = True)¶

This function sends the JSON response to the client after elaboration, returns False on failure or None if the timeout (generally 60 seconds) expires

async serve_forever()¶

This function is the server’s main loop, what it does is: - Starts to serve the asynchronous TCP socket - Waits forever for clients to connect and redirect them to the handle_client() function defined above

async setup()¶

This function is called when the server is started

async shutdown()¶

This function is called when the server shuts down

start()¶

AsyncAPY.errors module¶

exception AsyncAPY.errors.StopPropagation¶

Bases: Exception

This exception is called when Packet.stop_propagation() is called to prevent the runner function from going further and forwarding the request to the next handler in the queue
